page.title: 02Historical Names.
page.content: { Wednesbury}is named after the{Saxon} god of war WODEN (WODENSBERG) the origin of{Darlaston}is also supposed to be Saxon. Old Park Road is thought to be named for the{PARKES}family who were lords of the manor about 16C. {Butcroft}(Darlaston) gives rise to conflicting views either it is BUTTS (a place for archery) or BUTTES (ploughed land). { Cobden Street}is named after the free trade reformer and{Franchise Street} after the extension of voting rights in 1888. The{Bull Stake}and{The High Bullen} both stand as reminders of the pre-eminence of{blood sports}in the area around the 18C (Bull baiting, dog fighting and cock fighting). The lectern in Wednesbury Parish Church is supposed to be a game cock rather than an eagle.
